      • scale

        public static void scale(x10.lang.Int N,
         x10.lang.Double alpha,
         x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> x)
        Declaration: scale(N:x10.lang.Int,alpha:x10.lang.Double,x:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): void.
        x
= alpha. Raise number of data stored continuously in array X
by a factor of alpha. The incremental step is 1.
        

        Parameters:
        N - number of data to operate on
        alpha - scalar
        x - data array

                  x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mB,
                  x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mC,
                  x10.lang.Int M,
                  x10.lang.Int N,
                  x10.lang.Int K)
        

        Declaration: c_mat_mat_mult(mA:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mB:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mC:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},M:x10.lang.Int,N:x10.lang.Int,K:x10.lang.Int): void.
        Call the matrix multiplication implemented in C.  The source code of
this implementation can be found in wrap_blas.c.  This method is for
debugging and performance test purpose only.

        matrix_matrix_mult
        

        public static void matrix_matrix_mult(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mB,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mC,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> dim,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> scale,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> trans)
        

        Declaration: matrix_matrix_mult(mA:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mB:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mC:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},dim:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1},scale:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},trans:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1}): void.
        Compute mC(M,N) = alpha * mA(M,K) * mB(K,N) + beta * mC(M,N).
        

        Parameters:
        mA - the first matrix in multiplication
        mB - the second matrix in multiplication
        mC - the output matrix
        dim - dimension array [M, N, K], which are rows of mA, columns of mB, and columns of mC.
        scale - scalars [alpha, beta] applying on the first matrix and output matrix
        trans - integer array for transpose flags on the first and second matrix. 0 for non-transpose.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        sym_matrix_mult
        

        public static void sym_matrix_mult(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mB,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mC,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> dim,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> scale)
        

        Declaration: sym_matrix_mult(mA:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mB:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mC:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},dim:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1},scale:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): void.
        Compute mB =  alpha * op( mA ) * mB + beta * mB, where mA is lower symmetric matrix
        

        Parameters:
        mA - the first symmetric matrix in multiplication
        mB - the second triangular matrix in multiplication
        mC - the output matrix
        dim - dimension array [M, N], rows and columns of mC
        scale - scalars [alpha, beta] applying on the first matrix and output matrix

        tri_matrix_mult
        

        public static void tri_matrix_mult(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mB,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> dim,
                   x10.lang.Int tranA)
        

        Declaration: tri_matrix_mult(mA:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},mB:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1},dim:x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1},tranA:x10.lang.Int): void.
        Compute mB =  op( mA ) * mB, mA is non-unit triangular matrix.
        

        Parameters:
        mA - Double precision array storing triangular matrix mA.
        mB - Double precision array storing matrix mB, which also is the output.
        dim - dimension array [M, N], which are rows of mB and columns of mB. Lower/upper triangular flag sets the last value.
        tranA - transpose option for mA

        matrix_tri_mult
        

        public static void matrix_tri_mult(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                   x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mB,

        Compute mB =  mA * op( mB ), mB is non-unit triangular matrix.
        

        Parameters:
        mA - Double precision array storing matrix mA and output matrix.
        mB - Double precision array storing triangular matrix mB.
        dim - dimension array [M, N], which are rows of mB and columns of mB.
        tranB - transpose option for matrix mB

        matrix_vector_mult
        

        public static void matrix_vector_mult(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                      x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> x,

        Parameters:
        mA - the first matrix (right-side)
        x - left-side operand vector
        y - output vector
        dim - dimension array [M, N], which are rows and columns of mA
        scale - scalars [alpha, beta]
        transA - transpose flag for matrix mA

        Compute  y = alpha * mA * y + beta * y, where mA is symmetric matrix. Incremental step is 1.
        

        Parameters:
        mA - the symmetric matrix (right-side)
        x - left-side operand vector
        y - output vector
        dim - dimension array [M, N], which are rows and columns of mA
        scale - scalars [alpha, beta]

        Triangular-vector multply:  op(mA) * x = b, where mA is unit lower-non-diagonal matrix.
        

        Parameters:
        mA - the lower-non-diagonal matrix
        bx - right-hand side vector as input, and output
        N - leading dimension of mA
        tA - transpose option for mA

        tri_vector_solve
        

        public static void tri_vector_solve(x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> mA,
                    x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Double> bx,
                    x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> dim,

        Solve equation  mA * x = b, where mA is unit lower-triangular matrix.
        

        Parameters:
        mA - the unit lower-triangular matrix
        bx - right-hand side vector as input, and output
        dim - leading dimension and order of mA
        transA - transpose option for mA

                    x10.regionarray.Array<x10.lang.Int> dim,
